ACS Revises Plans for the 2020-2021 School Year

After much heartfelt discussion and based on guidance from local and state public health officials, the Board charged Superintendent Dr. Aaron Woody with developing a modified plan for remote learning to start the 2020-2021 school year.

Today we announce our plans to delay moving into Plan B.
Starting August 17, all students will work remotely from home with the exception of elementary students, and sixth and ninth grade students. For these students, the first week (week of August 17) will be an orientation week where families will sign up to meet with teachers, pick-up necessary materials (including computer devices), and learn the classroom management system. Thereafter, all students will work remotely until September 21, 2020. Schools will be sending information about orientation dates and times. This was a very difficult decision, but the safety and health of our students, their families, and our staff must remain our number one priority. Please stay tuned as more information about the 2020-2021 school year becomes available.

The Teacher of the Year from Charles W. McCrary Elementary School is Mr. Steve Watson!

Mr. Watson has not only served students and colleagues at his school for almost two decades, he has served our community in a number of roles. Mr. Watson is founder of the ACS Lacrosse Club, the Mustang Girls Volleyball Club, and the Boys Basketball Club. Additionally, he has partnered with Habitat for Humanity to create the Doghouse Build project, which allows third-grade students to apply their math skills to build dog houses that are then donated to the Randolph County Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RCSPCA). A separate collaboration Mr. Watson has spearheaded is the Mustang Family Build Day, which provides an opportunity for McCrary staff, students, and families to work on a Habitat house together. We could go on and on about the great work Mr. Watson has done in our school system and across our community. Ms. Watson, thank you for giving your all to our students. Congratulations!

Lindley Park Elementary School's Teacher of the Year is Mr. Ivan Quintero!

Mr. Quintero serves in our first-grade Dual Language Immersion classroom at Lindley Park. He joined our team at the beginning of the 2018-2019 school year. Prior to coming to Asheboro, Mr. Quintero has taught students across the world. He is an expert in bilingual education. During his 10-year career, Mr. Quintero has served in number of roles that support students in developing language skills in English, bi-literacy, and bilingualism. In addition to teaching, he was also a biliteracy researcher at the University of Quindio in Armenia, Columbia. Outside the classroom, Mr. Quintero facilitates English and Spanish Clubs to develop and improve bilingual competencies, and he is an active member of the Columbian Foundation, Corteza Terrestre, an organization committed to protecting stray dogs in Armenia, Columbia. Mr. Quintero, thank you for all that you do for our students and those across the world. Congratulations!

For this week's STEAM challenge, we encourage students and families to experiment with a simple machine - a lever. You will need a pencil, a wooden 12 in. ruler, tape, and coins. If you center the ruler on a taped-down pencil (the fulcrum), you should be able to balance the same number of coins on both sides of the ruler. Where would you need to place the center (fulcrum) to balance 3 and 4 coins, 2 and 4 coins, and 1 and 4 coins? Submit your photos/videos of this week's STEAM Challenge in the comments below or send them to steamchallenge@asheboro.k12.nc.us.
